title: Project Proposal
text:
ShinyGeode



Theme: Flow and Movement Data Analytics/ Geographical Accessibility and Spatial Interaction Models



Problem and Motivation
Traffic congestion in Cambodia has been a serious problem for years, and often has devastating effects such as fatal accidents. In 2021, a report by the National Road Safety Committee (NRSC) and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) found that road traffic congestion were one of the leading causes of death in Cambodia. Based on data collected in 2019, the report discovered that on average, there were 5 deaths due to traffic daily. (Phim et al., 2019). It was further stated that traffic congestion in the nation has risen almost 25% in the years between 2009-2019, and most of these accidents fell within the capital city of Phnom Penh.
Flow and Movement Analytics of traffic congestion hotspots in the capital city of Phnom Penh could provide insights on likely causes of traffic accidents. Other geographical analysis methods such as Exploratory Spatial Data Analysis techniques can help us identify any correlated factors that result in these congestions.
Video Links (motivation):

traffic congestion in cambodia




Project Objectives

Identify and detect the traffic hotspots, clusters, and outliers
Access global and local spatial autocorrelation in traffic congestions in Cambodia




Datasets

Cambodia - Subnational Administrative Boundaries




Approach and Methodology

Data Preparation

Sourcing data and Importing data
Data Wrangling

Processing imported data to keep only needed information
Restricting study area
Handling missing/duplicated data
Cleaning up of data
Examine data to identify patterns
Joining of boundary and working data
Perform a write and read to rds for easier access to variable


Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

Visualising graphs/maps of traffic congestion in various categories
Explore interactive or animative plots to showcase time-based flow of traffic activities

Global and Local Spatial Autocorrelation
Plotting our results and Interpretation
Conclusion
